Hello, I love the choice of including different ethnics in the Valyrian blood. Somehow, it reveals its greatness and grandeur : it was not the secret treasure of one dynasty, fragile, and doomed to disappear with the last heir of the latter. No. It ran through the veins of an entire continent, an empire that took over the world. The Valyrian blood remained constant through its diversity, like the original life force expressing itself in infinite ways. Now, we shall get to witness the stories of those once gifted with this power, mere men that could pretend to the title of gods. This, my friend, is most inspiring, do you not think ?

Brienne gets knighted by Jaime, Gendry gets legitimized by Daenerys, Daenerys sets sail for kings landing and somehow gets ambushed by a huge fleet which results in one of her dragons dieing, Jon doesn't want it. Varys dies sadly, Daenerys easily destroys the iron fleet and most of kings landings defences, The city rings the bells signaling surrender but Daenerys goes crazy for no reason and destroys the Geneva convention by razing Kings landing to the ground,The hound saves Arya's life ,Then he confronts his brother The Mountain and they fight and it looked like The Mountain was going to win until The Hound pushes the mountain off the tower/castle into the fire ultimately killing both of them. Cersei and Jaime are finally reunited and embrace each other and as Jaime sees the keep collapsing on top of them he comforts her before they are crushed, Tyrion finds them crushed. Daenerys proclaims she will liberate the entire world,Tyrion resigns as hand of the Queen and is imprisoned for treason. Jon follows Daenerys into the Red Keep to the throne room and before she is able to even sit down on the iron throne she is confronted by Jon who after they embrace stabs and kills her. Drogon then realizes what's happened and almost kills Jon but at the last moment redirects his anger at The Iron Throne melting it, then he picks up Daenerys body and flies away with it. Then for some reason Bran is proclaimed king of the six kingdoms six because the North was proclaimed a independent Kingdom and appoints Tyrion as his hand, Jon is sentenced to the Nights watch, Tyrion reorganizes the small council consisting of Bronn,Brienne,Davos and Sam, PODRICK IS FINALLY KNIGHTED.Sansa is proclaimed queen in the North, Arya sets sail west of Westeros, Jon rejoins tormund and Ghost at castle black who go beyond the wall in the last scene signaling the end Of A Game Of Thrones. The only way they would have ended the show was through writing a better storyline, at least let the golden company shine before burning them, like I understand the iron fleet getting burnt to even the playing field.   If I was the writer, I'd station the Dothraki forward to meet the Golden Company and see how the Golden Company fair against the greatest calvary, then sneak the Unsullied and men of the North into the city in a surprise attack to meet the Lannister forces. Tyrion would also sneak in with the Northmen and lace the sea with black fire, take some scorpions and fire at the Iron fleet with the Lannister army occupied at the gate, then when all is almost lost, when the Dothraki are retreating, let Dany come and burn them down, and burn the remaining iron fleet who have already suffered many casualties under the scorpions, with the North losing alot of men. Then as the Unsullied are almost defeated by the superior numbers of the Lannister army, the Dothraki(who were saved from the already torched Golden Company) come to their rescue. And a fight ensues between evenly matched Lannisters and a combined Unsullied and Dothraki army, meanwhile, the North move into the castle with the help of Tyrion where Jon Snow and the Hound fight the Mountain and win, they capture the castle and Cercei out of desparation blows up most of the city with wildfire not wanting it to be ruled by Cercei. Jaime Lannister who witnesses what Cercei has done, sneaks behind her and stabs her in the back crying. Meanwhile, the queen is proclaimed dead and the war ends. In the end, Jon is given the North to rule as King, Jaime is made the commander of the armies and Tyrion remains hand of the Queen and given Casterly Rock. The Dothraki, Unsullied and all armies are intergrated as one under a new banner with all the seven kingdoms. Meanwhile, emissaries are sent to the Bank to pay repatriation for hiring the Golden Company on behalf of Cercei and the money is used to rebuild the city. The other kingdoms are given the option to join the new queen or rule as democracies and many opt to join. After Dany is crowned queen, Drogon flies Dany to a place where she finds another dragon egg and Dany hides it and in her speech vows to use Dragons only when the dead return. Later she gets her baby and names him Eddard after Jon's father and the kingdom regains peace once more.

This will probably get deleted... but maybe it won't. I'm mixed race, criticizing the fact the valyrians are shown as black is not racist.  This argument is dishonest and lazy. I am all for diversity in shows, genuinely, if anything where is the east Asian people in the game of thrones universe? but *at least make it make sense.*  Show people from diverse locations. If you have to change the story to shoe horn in races it tells us one of two things, the people writing show, don't know, or don't care. Neither is good.  Consider for a moment that having black actors isn't simply done because the people at HBO are wonderful people, who just care so much about inclusivity. *It's a cynical corporate approach.* In case you haven't noticed there is millions of black people in America and mixed race people like me, they simply think they can widen the market and get more non-white viewers by shoe-horning in non white characters into roles that make no sense. If anything is racist it is cynical casting, assuming people  will watch the show more simply because of race.  It's lazy corporate bs, nothing more.  If they wanted more diversity all you have to do is have actual good writing. Showing people from diverse locations around the world of game of thrones, all different cultures and exotic locations. It's not diversity or smart writing if for example you just decide to get a bigger market share so you make a bunch of the Starks  have east Asian features so it will sell better in China, It would make no sense to the lore or world building. However we are doing the exact same thing here, but with people of African decent and everyone is afraid to even say anything for fear of being called racist, it is bizarre. Nobody was ever complaining that there wasn't more white people in Wakanda in Black panther, because that wouldn't make much sense would it?

(Copy from my comment of the same video in another channel)A little education: Valeryons(seafarers with a sea horse as a sigil;shown at 0:38-0:39) are closely related to Targaryens and as a matter of fact both were of valyeria, who escaped before it's doom. They bear a strong resemblance to targs i.e they were very very white and had silver white hair and blue and in some cases purple eyes. That is why when targs couldn't find a sibling to marry they looked towards valyerions to keep the blood of valeyria  pure. They were a great house during the civil war/dance of dragons.   Moving on, the dornish(most of them) due to huge influx of rhyonish(river people of East) blood have wheatish or olive skin and are comparably said too look like some latinos and South Asians. And so does the people of essos in large number look a bit darker than people of westroes who are white because of their andal and first men ancestry.   The people of Yi Ti in far east look like east Asians while the people of summer islanders look like natives of much of africa.   So there is no lack of racial diversity in grrm's world but the showrunners still decided to fuck it up. And it is not of a charcter whose race doesn't matter, but of character whose relation to targs due to the sole fact that they are very VERY similar. I just finished watching 6 seasons of the History Channel's ' Vikings ' & found it to be infinitely better than Game of Thrones, here's why -  - There is no 'sexpositioning' : I don't have to compulsorily watch intimate scenes to learn important plot details, the crucial plot points are explained through conversations & real emotions and intimate scenes are about intimacy between two characters.  - Characters have clearly defined motivations and goals which evolve overtime instead of things like ' I will stay in Mereen ( for no apparent reason ) '   - No abandoned plotlines & hundreds unfired chekov's guns - everything and every character has a beginning and an end.  - Actions have real consequences, the unexpected deaths are crucial to the plot and have long-lasting consequences on the story, they aren't just a means to an end for discarding characters out of the story and which are forgotten like Robb Stark.  - The large army battles actually use strategy instead of screaming dragons.  - ' My name is Bran, I'm a cripple and I cannot fight ' vs ' I am Ivar the Boneless !! '  - The supernatural element of the show is more related to fate, religion and spirituality instead of being a mute monster to defeat who leads a zombie army with ice powers.  - The story takes place over two generations, there is no need to cram everything into one tale.  And the list goes on and on.

â€œMadness and greatness are two sides of the same coin. Every time a new Targaryen is born, the gods toss the coin in the air and the world holds its breath to see how it will land.â€  This will be a bit long. I'm one who loved the unpredictable and unsafe nature of GOT. I wasn't "rooting" for anyone to win the Throne, that's not what the whole series is truly about. I hate how it's hip to hate on the show now from casual TV show viewers who need a certain ending or typical clichÃ© storybook shit. GOT wasn't afraid to go against the grain, plot armor cast aside, and your favorites could end up in a shitty places doing shitty things.  Looking at the like/dislike ratio lets me know fans can get passed the ending of GOT and how it didn't fit their ideas. GOT showed that it was an unforgiving show that mirrored life and that cookie cutter endings in Dark Fantasy aren't like LOTR. The only other material that I know that's just as unforgiving is the Soulsborne games. These books and tv shows are for fans of those kinda of dark/depressing themes. So forget your cookie cutter hero/heroine riding a dragon into the sunset having defeated all the evils of Westeros.   I also think too many people attached themselves to Daenerys, Jon, and other characters. Naming their kids after her, or getting tattoos of her sayings and all kings of things. They wanted that character to stand for something in our world and our times, when this is a dark fantasy world of truly ugly and mad people. Never go into a show like GOT expecting a normal story arc or attach yourself to anyone. Just enjoy the journey and applaud the fact they didn't end the series like Lost, going for emotions instead of consequential arcs.   If the show runners or writers ever come across this comment I appreciate what you did and even though it didn't go how I expected I respect you didn't just cave in and do the same fantasy tropes we've experienced so many times.
Wait Doctor who is now a Dragon King
Heck yes! Me and my dragon tattoo are ready!
Seasons 7and 8  of thrones were really one season. They decided to chop it in half and spread it out over time. By over a year and a half apart. This is where the showrunners failed. All that time and people bitch that season 8 feels rushed. However, when you watch 7 and 8 back to back as like one season it isn't as bad as those who make it out to be. The show garnered a massive audience so no matter what not everything was going to satisfy all. For me bran being the one in the end just simply didn't work and felt kind of tacked on. That and cersei's end was not satisfying. Either danearys should have killed her by having her dragon eat her, or have Sansa kill her. Those would have made more sense because both had all the motive in the world to end cersei. Jon snow was ok end albeit kind of anti climatic but still ok. Sansa and arrya had the best arcs of the whole show imo. As for Daenerys "suddenly"turning crazy um did noone watch the first few seasons? She killed, made a bargain to get her husband saved from death which backfired, killed many people. And towards the end kept on with the bend the knee to me power trip. So her madness was more of an obsession than anything.  And anything to accomplish her goal of getting that throne. My favorite moment of the whole show is when drago melts the throne. I thought it was powerful and was the true end for that part of the throne saga. Now we can see what happens when the Targaryen reigned and perhaps all the way to their eventual downfall.
Since the fandom has been revived here I'm just gonna mention that it's been confirmed by GRRM that Bran will sit on the Iron Throne by the end of ASOIAF books, D&D had the right conclusion but the execution leading up to it was rushed and lackluster, but it is what it is. Not that unbelievable in hindsight since the first chapter of the first book is from Bran's POV so the last chapter of the final book will most likely be about him as well - also we should remember that the Targaryens ruled Westeros but the Starks were the FIRST and most ancient house and were already kings of Winter for 8,000 years before the Targaryens even set foot on Westeros land and proclaimed themselves as the official rulers who united Westeros for 300 years. In a way it's poetic how it all comes back full circle. Ever wonder why the final book's initial title was "A Time for Wolves?"

I don't think they could have picked a better period from George's vast history to adapt as this will have all the elements people loved about GOT: multi-faceted characters, twisting and turning political intrigue, epic and costly (in terms of budget and dramatic loss) battles, and high fantasy dragons galore. What's new here from GOT is that the conflict is all couched within an inter-family civil war, which will only heighten the drama in certain respects, as we all know what it's like to fall out with your family members, though usually your family don't have dragons to make matters worse... or better in this case! Plus, this show has a clear beginning, middle and end, so no final-hour missteps in the writers room we can hope!

there are many interesting things to note throughout this teaser which i would highly recommend looking out for. this took me a while to do but i hope it helps out anyone wanting further info on the trailer :D  -CHARACTERS 0:10 Rhaenyra Targaryen and Daemon Targaryen (possibly on the shores of Dragonstone?) 0:20 Identified Otto Hightower, identified by the badge of Hand of the King and the chain around his neck 0:23 King Viserys Targaryen "the young" sitting on the iron throne holding an un named sword (i don't think its valyrian) 0:29 Young Rhaenyra 0:40 Mysaria,  its a brief shot but shows how she will be a key character in the series, ally and concubine of Daemon 0:41 A young Queen Alicent being shadowed by members of the kingsguard (not sure why she's holding a kinfe) HOWEVER it does look raaaaather a lot like the dagger wielded by the catspaw and then arya, interested to see where this goes    -DRAGON HEAD at 0:19 ,  perhaps this is some kind of altar for the Targaryens owing to the candles in front of it, or it could just be an actual dragon?  -DRAGON KNIGHT i would assume that this is Daemon Targaryen at his brother Viserys' tourney at maidenpool. he is fighting an un named knight, who, assuming this is the tourney at Maidenpool is Ser Criston Cole. The dragon knight can be identified as Daemon as he is the only man of fighting age in the Targaryen family, at the time this was set (assuming this is not a flash back), he is also dressed in fine plate that would only be reserved for royals and is possibly wielding Dark Sister, the sword bestowed on him by Jaeherys I.   -HOUSE VELARYON it seems like this is slightly more faithful to the old lore of the valyrians, i think i saw the predecessors of the house of Velaryon at 0:39 with the braided hair- identified by the sea horse as their crest, however this could be another house entirely. This is further reinforced by the fact that the character Emma D'arcy plays is Rhaenyra Targaryen, who in the book "fire and blood, married Laenor Velaryon of Driftmark, perhaps   -FEAST IN THE RED KEEP looking closely, the iron throne is placed on a dais, however is empty as it is a feast, behind the dais are the banners of house Targaryen and Velaryon. People seated in Rows are looking towards a character in the foreground, presumably Rhaenyra owing to the way her hair has been done (this is tenuous but its the best i could come up with)  -JOUST  you can see the banners of various great houses however the most notable part of this scene is the clash between the two knights. the Crests of house Cole and another house- i don't think its house targaryen even though i can make out the red and black, possibly house Kargyll, (cole being nine black pellets  on a red field and Kargyll being A golden goose on bendy sinister black and red) once again reinforcing the idea that the tourney will happen at maidenpool.    TWO MEN FIGHTING i assume one of the men is Daemon based on his hair, not sure who the other person is though  IRON THRONE okay, its big! once again looks like Rhaenyra, possibly walking towards Jaeherys  also, bit of a stretch hello to Alt shift X if you read this :D

Okay everyone, place your bets, what do we think they're gonna change from the book?  My guesses:  * Reduce the number of characters, dragon-riders especially. I reckon they'll lose Aegon II's youngest brother Daeron the Daring and his dragon Tessarion, along with Rhaenyra's Strong sons. Baela and Rhaena (Daemon's two daughters) will be merged together, most likely keeping the name Baela (since they don't like having multiple characters with the same/similar names, it confuses the Normals). We'll probably shed most of the Dragonseeds too, I definitely see Hugh Hammer and Ulf the White being merged into a single character, and I've a feeling that we'll see Addam of Hull merged with Alyn Velaryon (the future Oakenfist), and he'll die in the Second Battle of Tumbleton. We'll probably also see the number of dragons killed in the Storming of the Dragonpit reduced, with some of them being merged with Syrax and whichever dragon they give to Aegon the Younger here.  Though they're not dragon-riders, I also think they'll reduce the number of Aegon's kids, merging Jaehaerys with Maelor, and him being killed by Blood and Cheese. I imagine Dalton Greyjoy and his raiding of the Westerlands will also be written out.  * Streamline the war. Thanks to the Strong kids being taken out, Viserys will take their roles; disfiguring Aemond years before, acting as message runner for the Blacks (including going north to secure the help of Cregan Stark) and then be killed by Aemond over Storm's End. The early fighting in the Riverlands between houses Blackwood and Bracken will be cut, as will the entire plot with the Triarchy that ends with the Battle of the Gullet. The Fishfeed will be the first major battle we see, fought by Cregan Stark and his winter wolves instead of Roderick Dustin, though he'll manage to survive. He'll also be the one who goes about the Butchers' Ball, and has Criston Cole killed off so satisfyingly anticlimactically. Hm, though now I say that, they might decide it's _too_ anticlimactic, and have him actually fight a duel with Stark instead.  The various battles of Tumbleton will be merged together, with "Ulf the Hammer" changing sides only to be killed fighting "Addam Oakenfist". Rhaenyra will still go ahead with ordering Nettles's death, Daemon and Aemond will still kill each other over the Gods' Eye. I think we'll also lose the Lads (pity, since I rather like them), and the battle of the Kingsroad will be fought by Cregan Stark and his characters leftover from the Fishfeed, with perhaps the inclusion of Black Aly Blackwood if we're lucky.  That's about it for me. What do you guys think they'll do with it?

Race swapping characters and retconning story points for inclusivity doesn't make any sense. Corlys Valaryon is not a african character, not as he was described in the books. He was of pale skin with velvet eyes. I highly doubt it that george actually created the character to be like this. He does not look like a man of velaryon decent. He looks like a man from the summer Isles. Im just irritated when people take established characters and then race swap them for just because........People rave about inclusivity. Then called racist in pointing out the inaccuracies. If corlys was of Summer Iles decent and was a member of the Targaryen dynasty, that i would accept.
